title: Effects of burning and photochemical degradation of Macondo surrogate oil on its composition and toxicity
content:
Environ. Sci.: Processes Impacts, 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D4EM00023D, Paper
Pamela P. Benz, Phoebe Zito, Ed Osborn, Aleksandar I. Goranov, Patrick G. Hatcher, Matthew D. Seivert, Wade H. Jeffrey
When water accommodated fractions made from burned and unburned oil were exposed to light, burning of crude oil removes some, but not all toxic compounds, leaving behind compounds of considerable toxicity.
